Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Obesity and OSAS on Morphine Pharmacokinetics in Children

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised into three groups

Participants.evidence: children aged 5–12 years scheduled for surgery

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised into three groups: nonobese with severe OSAS, obese with severe OSAS, and a control group.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate the independent effects of obesity, OSAS, and leptin on morphine metabolism in children.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the dose-adjusted mean maximum morphine concentration (C MAX ) over 540 minutes.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were employed

Number_Randomised.evidence: Thirty-four patients were randomised: 16 controls, 8 nonobese/OSAS, and 10 obese/OSAS.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The obese/OSAS group showed a higher C MAX compared to controls (P < .001) and nonobese/OSAS (P = .014).
